item.title: Reading events from disk, fast
item.description: Data formats for event-based data When recording a video using a conventional camera, you record all the frames and only then compress the stream for storage in post-processing, for example through frame difference encoding. This is a major reason why your GB-sized raw video can shrink to MBs easily when using video codecs such H.264. In contrast to conventional cameras, event cameras only record changes in illumination rather than absolut brightness, and therefore output compressed data to begin with.
